tournament.name: Duel Commander Mensal - Academia de Jogos

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counter spells and removals to disrupt opponents' strategies. With Grand Arbiter Augustin IV as the commander, the deck aims to slow down opponents' plays by taxing their spells and mana. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, such as Force of Will and Counterspell, along with removal spells like Wrath of God and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board. The addition of card draw spells like Fact or Fiction and Dig Through Time ensures that the deck can maintain card advantage. The deck also includes various planeswalkers like Teferi, Temporal Archmage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide additional control options and win conditions.

This deck is focused on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as the commander, providing card advantage and recursion. The main deck includes a variety of lands for fixing and utility, along with powerful spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Demonic Tutor. The deck also includes a mix of creature threats like Sower of Temptation and Glen Elendra Archmage, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. With a focus on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

This Tasigur control deck focuses on efficiently controlling the opponent's resources while maintaining card advantage and flexibility. It utilizes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck includes powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Liliana of the Veil, Force of Will, and Toxic Deluge to handle threats efficiently. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the three colors required, with support from fetch lands, shock lands, and utility lands. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck revolves around utilizing Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander to create an explosive combo with cards like Earthcraft, Skullclamp, and Goblin Bombardment. The main focus is to generate tokens with Prossh's ability and sacrifice them to generate value and deal damage to opponents. The deck also includes a variety of mana ramp creatures and spells to accelerate the game, along with card draw engines like Sylvan Library and Phyrexian Arena. Additionally, there are tutor cards like Demonic Tutor and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces, generate value through sacrificing tokens, and overwhelm opponents with a powerful board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Teferi, Temporal Archmage as the commander to generate infinite mana and take multiple turns in a row. The deck includes various mana rocks and ways to untap them, as well as powerful draw spells and counterspells to control the game. By assembling the right pieces and building up mana, the deck can cast spells like Time Stretch, Time Warp, and Temporal Trespass to take extra turns and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, with the ability to bounce and counter threats, the deck aims to stall the game until it can execute its combo and secure a win through overwhelming card advantage and extra turns.

The key strategy revolves around utilizing Narset's ability to cast powerful spells for free by attacking. The deck is filled with a variety of control spells such as counterspells, board wipes, and removal to control the game and protect Narset. The mana base is designed to support Narset's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the needed colors. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Ajani Vengeant and Jace, the Mind Sculptor adds another dimension to the control strategy, providing additional ways to control the game and protect Narset. Overall, the deck aims to control the board, protect Narset, and win through powerful spells and planeswalker abilities.

The main focus of the deck is to utilize Selvala's ability to generate mana and draw cards by playing small creatures and untapping Selvala to ramp up quickly. The deck includes a variety of mana dorks, ramp spells, and untap effects to create a large mana advantage. It also includes various tutors and card draw spells to find key combo pieces like Umbral Mantle and Staff of Domination to generate infinite mana. The deck aims to overrun opponents with a large number of creatures, potentially tutoring for Craterhoof Behemoth or Genesis Wave to finish the game. The inclusion of disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares and Banishing Light helps to control the board and protect the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells and control the game. It utilizes cards like Ramping Growth, Explosive Vegetation, and Cultivate to ramp up mana, while also disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal spells. Maelstrom Wanderer's ability to cascade into two spells for free allows the deck to maintain card advantage and continuously put pressure on opponents. The deck also includes various planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon for additional control and win conditions. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana, control the board, and overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and creatures.
